greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) is the n-th prime whose decimal expansion begins with the decimal expansion of k; square array A(n,k), n>=1, k>=1, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 1..200, flattened
Index entries for primes involving decimal expansion of n
maple: A:= proc(n, k) local l, p;
l:= proc() [] end; p:= proc() -1 end;
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := Module[{l, p}, l[_] = {}; p[_] = -1; While[Length[l[k]] < n, p[k] = p[k]+1; l[k] = Join[l[k], u[k, p[k]]]]; l[k][[n]]];
Table[Table[A[n, 1+d-n], {n, 1, d}], {d, 1, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2019, from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 20 2015
